Package program

Class HomeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • program.HomeController

  • public class HomeController
extends java.lang.Object
    Class HomeController will handle the home screen for the user. It contains a TableView, as I expect the user to view the products right when they log in.
    Since:
    2018-12-09
    Author:
    Luca Missaglia

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​()
        Initialize productTable cleaning it from any residual values (if user logs out and logs in). Set each column of productTable to tableColumns defined (each one is an attribute of Product). Initialize combobox with values in observableList, and set first selection to first item of list.

      • changeDetails

        public void changeDetails​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Go to changeDetails page.

      • logout

        public void logout​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Logs out user (set static variable loggedUser to ""). Clear table from any products loaded into it. Return to login page.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - - mouse click

      • showProducts

        public void showProducts​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Function showProducts takes the combobox choice the user made, selects product code, and runs query on DB based on beginning of product code. Then with the data from the result of the query, creates an object of type Product that is then added to the TableView to be displayed in ASC order.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - - mouse click

      • userPanel

        public void userPanel​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Go to user panel page.

      • addSupplies

        public void addSupplies​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Go to add supplies page.

      • changeSite

        public void changeSite​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Go to change site page.

      • removeSupplies

        public void removeSupplies​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Go to delete product page.
